item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, April 17, 2025 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Zoom outage caused by accidental 'shutting down' of the zoom.us domain (208 points | 110 comments)
2. Jellyfin as a Spotify alternative (190 points | 168 comments)
3. Demolishing the Fry's Electronics in Burbank (90 points | 51 comments)
4. OpenAI Codex CLI: Lightweight coding agent that runs in your terminal (364 points | 199 comments)
5. Darwin's children drew all over the “On the Origin of Species” manuscript (2014) (353 points | 101 comments)
6. Show HN: Plandex v2 – open source AI coding agent for large projects and tasks (85 points | 23 comments)
7. Concurrency in Haskell: Fast, Simple, Correct (29 points | 15 comments)
8. 12-factor Agents: Patterns of reliable LLM applications (271 points | 47 comments)
9. TLS certificate lifetimes will officially reduce to 47 days (395 points | 518 comments)
10. "Vivarium": The keeper of a lab's animals stumbles onto a secret [fiction] (21 points | 1 comment)
11. Damn Vulnerable MCP Server (165 points | 50 comments)
12. Unix files have (at least) two sizes (45 points | 13 comments)
13. Man who built ISP instead of paying Comcast expands to hundreds of homes (2022) (353 points | 169 comments)
14. How Nintendo bled Atari games to death (181 points | 126 comments)
15. How a Forgotten Battle Created a More Peaceful World (69 points | 23 comments)
16. Query Engines: Push vs. Pull (2021) (47 points | discuss)
17. OpenAI o3 and o4-mini (458 points | 416 comments)
18. Kermit: A typeface for kids (276 points | 140 comments)
19. eInk Mode: Making web pages easier to read (99 points | 36 comments)
20. Breaking the Llama Community License (122 points | 67 comments)
21. OneSignal (YC S11) Is Hiring Engineers ( | hide)
22. CVE Foundation (313 points | 62 comments)
23. Reproducing Hacker News writing style fingerprinting (230 points | 116 comments)
24. Sony Unveils the Smallest and Lightest Lidar Depth Sensor (36 points | 10 comments)
25. A high-throughput parser for the Zig programming language (110 points | 9 comments)
26. RakuAST Grant Report (45 points | 2 comments)
27. Nix Trigonometric Math Library from Ground Zero (14 points | discuss)
28. Dirty tricks 6502 programmers use (2019) (143 points | 44 comments)
29. Microsoft researchers developed a hyper-efficient AI model that can run on CPUs (89 points | 33 comments)
30. Launch HN: Jasmine (YC S22) – Automating REC compliance and payouts for solar (37 points | 18 comments)
